remarks: Whenever there are at least 4 atoms under ` P .\/ Q ` (specifically, ` P ` , ` Q ` , ` r ` , and ` ( P .\/ Q ) ./\ W ` ), there are also at least 4 atoms under ` P .\/ S ` .  This proves the statement in Lemma E of [Crawley] p. 114, last line, "...p ` \/ ` q/0 and hence p ` \/ ` s/0 contains at least four atoms..."  Note that by ~ cvlsupr2 , our ` ( P .\/ r ) = ( Q .\/ r ) ` is a shorter way to express ` r =/= P /\ r =/= Q /\ r .<_ ( P .\/ Q ) ` .  (Contributed by NM, 27-May-2013.)
